reviews.title: Stay somewhere else! Beware!
reviews.text: We had reserved the "deluxe riverview" cabin. First of all there was no riverview and the "cabins" are dumpy duplexes. Upon entering there was a horrendous smell, and it was freezing cold. We took some plates out to cook dinner and they were dirty. When going to use the bathroom, the toilet and been used and not flushed. The sink was clogged, the shower was dirty. The beds had one thin blanket and when we pulled off the blanket from the 2nd bed to keep warm there were stains all over it. It was completely disgusting and impossible to keep warm. We would have left that night but it was late and no way of finding out what else might have been available. We left first thing in the morning. In addition as someone else has said, it is well over an hour into Yosemite so it will be about a 2 1/2 hr roundtrip drive. Definitely find somewhere else to stay!

reviews.title: This place is pretty dumpy!
reviews.text: This place is pretty dumpy! We stayed in the 3 bedroom cabin which is probably the nicest unit. The brochure is very misleading and I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody. My daughter got sick and we wanted to head home on the third night and they wouldn't even refund our money. Stay somewhere else!

reviews.title: Find some where else
reviews.text: We made reservations on line for this motel to stay two nights during July in Yosemite. The web site brochure was extremely misleading!! The riverside view was a joke. You could not even see the "river" which actually was no more than a creek from our room. The building had paper thin walls and floors. We could hear the people below us as well as the people next to us. The stairs creaked everytime someone walked up or down them. The motel is located off the main road about a quarter of a mile so you can't see it from the highway. When you drive in the entrance the only buildings that were pictured on the web site brochure were the "office" and the two-story building we stayed in. The rest of the place looked like a junk yard. Some buildings were falling apart and there was a couple of trailers near the motel area that made it look like a junk yard. They offered a "continental breakfast" up to 10:00 a.m. and when we to get breakfast, they only had one yogurt left and coffee. Everything else was gone. When we asked about the other items we were told "they ran out". Our air conditioner (window unit) never got the room quite cool enough even after running for over 8 hours. The web site said only 9 miles from the entrance to Yosemeite but unless you are familiar with the park which being from Florida left us out, it was another hour and a quarter drive to get down into the valley where we were planning on meeting up with some friends that were staying there. It took us over two hours to make the trip from our motel to the valley and back. That was not mentioned anywhere on the web site. I was completely disgusted with the location and the condition of the motel. After one night (we had paid for two nights) we went to talk to the office before 11:00 a.m. to request a refund for the next night or even a partial refund but we were told that they do not give refunds. Even after pointing out all the issues we had with the room, the noise, the odor from the carpet and the distance they would not budge. They said that they rely on reservations to survive because of where they are located and they do not give refunds. I felt cheated by this motel and I would never recommend this place to anyone and would discourage you from staying there. I wish I had seen the other review before we made the reservations!

reviews.title: Don't Trust the Brochure
reviews.text: I made reservations for a May-June 2003 stay with my wife based on Yosemite Riverside Inn's (Groveland) website and a recommendation from another website devoted to lodging in and around Yosemite National Park. We thought we were going to an inn situated in a 'park-like setting.' What we found, instead, was a collection of buildings, some in OK shape, but others in evident disrepair, with a couple of old house trailers on the property. We thought we'd get a quiet, cozy cabin. What we got was a premium-priced 'riverview' cabin (probably built in the 1940s and consisting of two rental units) that, while thoughtfully refurbished with new kitchen, bath, and paneling, was not level--and had no river view). It was like being in a slightly listing ship (I kept thinking of the Titanic while there). The window screens were torn, so, with mosquitoes in force, the windows could not be safely opened. On top of that we had ant problems and the place had the odor of insecticide. There seemed no soundproofing between our unit and the adjoining one, so instead of sound of the river, we heard our neighbor's noisy air conditioning unit, bathroom noises, etc. etc. Unfortunately, the owner-managers were not particularly up-front about these 'features.' When making reservations, I had asked if there were any issues at all with the accommodations and was told there were none. The cancellation policy was not customer-friendly. We will not stay there again. A warning to other Yosemite visitors: In an area where demand often outstrips supply, much lodging possessing good website brochures are places that saw better times many years ago. Find trusted review sources if possible.

reviews.title: Not much for the money
reviews.text: We stayed at the Yosemite Riverside Inn on a weekday night for $89, too much for a very basic room, off-season, and without breakfast. The room was clean, but it appeared to be suffering from age and neglect. The floor buckled in a few places, and the door let in light at the top because it did not fit correctly in the door jamb.

reviews.title: Very Pleasant
reviews.text: Although the TV had satellite service, it got only about five channels, which included religous broadcasting but none of the networks.

The refund policy is too strict: A seven-day notice was required for a refund. Given that it was off-season and there was a real possibility that inclement weather could change travel plans, in the future I will look for a place in which you could cancel much closer to the day of arrival. The night we stayed, only one or two other rooms were occupied; a week's notice of cancellation was unnecessary.
reviews.title: Decent lodging but not worth the money
Definitely Not Coming Back!
reviews.text: Our stay has been very pleasant. We were at room no. 10.

reviews.title: Oh, come on, it's not that bad
reviews.text: Yes I'd do it! (recommend others) Because the environment.

reviews.title: uh oh, don't go!
reviews.text: While the reviews in trip advisor were good, and we based our reservation on them, travellers should be aware of our recent experience. The rivreside room we paid a premium for was not in good repair. Two wall light fixtures were falling off of the walls and inoperable. The faucets in the shower were also in disrepair. The ambiance was more of a trailer park, with unsightly views. The river was not really very accessible or attractive.

reviews.title: Lovely
reviews.text: But here was the really bad news. On our second day, we returned from Yosemite touring at 5 pm, having left at 7 am, and found the inn without power. That meant no AC, no water, no telephone., not even a coke machine It was 100 degrees. The owner refused to give us a credit for the second night and did not want us to leave. The power had been out since 2 oclock according to other local merchants. He told us it had been out since 4 pm. He had no rational explanation as to why he had not fixed the things that were broken in our room, although we had given him a written maintenance slip at 7 a.m.

reviews.title: Great and Beautiful
reviews.text: Also be advised, the inn offers a self serve breakfast, but it does not open until 7:30 a.m. That is too late for a place that caters to people going to the park, when getting an early start on the 35 mile drive is important. It is too late. IF you are there from the east coast, you are getting up early anyway, and it really helps to be at the park early during the summer if you want to avoid the heat and the crowds.

reviews.title: Great Relaxing
reviews.text: Bottom line: explore other gates to Yosemite where there may be more choices. The gate near Groveland does not have many.

reviews.title: This Place is Great. Woods-River-Nature-Peacefull-Tranquil-FreshAIR
reviews.text: We stayed in a cabin. Lovely area, wonderful cabin and super stay. I would recommend others to Yosemite Riverside Inn.

We chose to stay at this hotel from some favorable reviews of other Trip Advisors - we should have followed the advice of the unfavorable reviews. The hotel truly has the look and feel more of a trailer park than that of a quaint Inn that we were expecting. The room that we had was small with dirty shag carpeting - we didn't want to take our shoes off after entering the room. The room had a musty odor that we tried to eliminate with the noisy window AC unit that must have been 30 years old. The sheets were paper thin and the towels were thin rags. The only phone that was available was one pay phone in the parking lot! This was a very disappointing hotel experience.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Clean and comfortable. All things functional but not elegant. Quiet and peaceful. Rooms overlook the river. Some distance from Yosemite Park entrance. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked our reservation for 2nights through DNC's website for August 25th and 26th. The price was a bit much, but hey, we were as close to the park as we could be, since the park inside was sold out. It only took us about 10 minutes to get to the entrance of the park, and another half hour to get to the valley, with manyphoto opportunities along the way. The manager was kind enough to let us check in 2 hours earlier than their stated 3pm check in time. There was a fridge and microwave in the room, but we weren't sure if the fridge was working the first night. Our room faced the creek, and it wasn't until the second day that I opened the window and got to listen to it running. The room was spacious, and we were even able to keep our bikes in the room with no problems. The bathroom could have used an upgrade, but the water stayed hot through our long showers, and overall was clean. The king-sized bed was clean, and big enough for my 6 foot tall boyfriend to fit on it without having his feet hang over the edge. The TV offered an adequate number of channels, though we hardly used it. We didn't take advantage of the continental breakfast in the main lodge, but the seating area for it looked cute and inviting.
reviews.title: Not too sure...

likes.liked: — listening to the creek running outside our window

reviews.title: I took a chance and lost !!!!
reviews.text: What made me decide never to stay there ever again... is somewhat of a tip for anyone staying there... make sure that if you put the "do not disturb" sign up, that they do see you around the hotel the days you are staying there, or else they will think you have left before your checkout time/day and will go and check your room. We were showering our last morning there, and (I am assuming) the husband of the manager was trying to open our room door. There are blinds on the window of the door, and I ran to the door, freaked out that a man had unlocked and was starting to open our door. He still continued to try and open the door even after I pushed the lock back in and started screaming! Because of the direction of the blinds, I'm sure he got a nice view of all of me, and after that, all I wanted to do was hurry up and leave. He later apologized, saying that many people leave the sign on their door after they leave, so he goes and checks the rooms. But mind you, he came to our room around 9am to check (checkout time is 11am!), and didn't knock first, just started unlocking the door and trying to open it! I wouldn't stay there again, just because of what happened... we're going back to the park in October '06 for a family wedding, and we're staying at the Yosemite Lodge instead... We'll see how that turns out... to be continued...

What ever you do stay away from this place!!! I was taking the family on a last minute vacation and booked a room at the riverside inn. I did read all of the bad reveiws but decideded to take a chance.That was a big mistake. The onsite managers were so friendly when they were collecting the cash from me but once they were paid it was a differnt story. When i went to talk to the manager about the room not having the sleeper sofa for my daughter,we got the door shut in our face(she slept on the foor).There were kids running up and down the stairs till 9pm. we left a day early and forfeited our second day.This place is in need of work. windows are hard to open, screens are bent allowing bugs to come in, and the kitchen and bathroom are a joke. Stay away from the riverside inn. Don't make the same mistake I did..........................
reviews.title: Stay Somewhere Else!!!!!!!
